briefdescription.para: The local anchor point on BodyA
The maximum constraint force that can be exerted to move the candidate body. Usually you will express as some multiple of the weight (multiplier * mass * gravity).
The damping ratio. 0 = no damping, 1 = critical damping.
This requires a world target point, tuning parameters, and the time step.
Get the reaction force on body at the joint anchor in Newtons.
Get the reaction torque on the body at the joint anchor in N*m.

simplesect.para: returns true if the position errors are within tolerance.

briefdescription.para: A mouse joint is used to make a point on a body track a specified world point. This a soft constraint with a maximum force. This allows the constraint to stretch and without applying huge forces. NOTE: this joint is not documented in the manual because it was developed to be used in the testbed. If you want to learn how to use the mouse joint, look at the testbed.
